Southwold Library

Manager: Charlotte Clark

North Green, Southwold
IP18 6AT

Tel: 01502 722519
Fax: 01502 722519
Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
Friends group: Friends of Southwold Library

Social media:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: on-street parking only
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Refreshments: hot drinks for sale
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • For sale:
    • Adopt a library animal: online or by picking up a form from the library. Minimum Â£10 donation.
    • Crafts, Southwold and Suffolk Coast Treasure Trails sheets.
    • Local authors' books.
    • Branded bags and pens.
  • Also available: laminating (up to A4), foodbank collection point all year round.

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow an iPad
  • Photocopying: available in colour and black and white up to A4 size
  • Colour printing: available up to A4 size
  • Scan to email
  • Fax
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Children's events

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Sunday, 1030-1100

Songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Tuesday, 1030-1100

Songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers.

Lego Club

Sunday, 1215-1300

Open to children (and adults) of all ages. Help and donations of Lego appreciated.

Storytime: stories, crafts and colouring for children under 7 years old

Sunday, 1130-1215

Older people's events

Colouring for adults

fourth Tuesday of the month, 1400

Unwind, unleash your creativity, relax and have fun. Use our sheets and materials or bring your own. Refreshments available.

Craft and Chat for adults

second Tuesday of the month, 1400

Bring your own craft to work on and meet like-minded crafters. Refreshments available.

Jigsaw Club for adults

first, third and fifth Tuesday of the month, 1400

Come and add some pieces to the latest jigsaw.

Lego for adults

first Tuesday of the month, 1900

Come and build whatever you like. Stress relieving, creative and fun. Lego and refreshments provided.

Lego for adults

last Wednesday of the month, 1400

Come and build whatever you like. Stress relieving, creative and fun. Lego and refreshments provided.

French for improvers: for those with some previous learning

Monday, 1400-1530
